intro: Chaenorhinum serpyllifolium subsp. robustum, commonly known as the robust wallflower, is a flowering plant in the family Violaceae. It is characterized by its erect, branched stems and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. The leaves are typically linear to lanceolate, with a hairy surface, and the plant is often found growing in disturbed soils or along pathways. It is a perennial herb that thrives in temperate climates and is known for its ability to colonize rocky or gravelly habitats. This subspecies is closely related to other members of the Chaenorhinum genus, which are generally adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
